title: Regarding the most recent ban wave for unauthorized Third-Party Applications
body:
Hey all —

We are aware of the recent outcry regarding being banned for usage of unauthorized Third-Party Applications. We hear you and have reviewed the most recent actions. We were able to verify the concerns that the community has raised here on the forums as well as reports we received from the Player Support team that let us know something seemed off with the last ban wave. After a deep dive into the actions over the last few days, we were able to identify a mislabel in the system. This led to a few accounts being incorrectly identified as cheating. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience that may have been caused.

What are we doing?
If the account was incorrectly mislabeled, we will be unbanning the account — an email notice will be sent to the registered email address letting you know that the account was unbanned. As of this post, all accounts that were overturned have been unbanned and emails sent to their accounts.

replies.body: If you mistakenly banned someone's account, will a compensation/ apology be given? Like maybe a free random champion thing in hextech? Or like 1k IP or will the person just be left alone with their account?
Wait, why the heck was my post down voted, the person didn't even comment on why? :( I don't think anything I said was wrong
I think it got downvoted because it sounded like entitlement. Like  "I better get compensation for this traumatic experience"
I don't see how it's downvote worthy though.  Riot messed up and ruined someone's League experience for a bit.  I would think they would want to make it up to their players somehow.

>I don't see how it's downvote worthy though.

Because people didn't agree with it or just didn't like it. That's *explicitly* the purpose of the voting system, to vote on the value we find in posts. Nobody "deserves" anything, it's completely up to ourselves whether or not we vote up or down. 

Someone is acting entitled? I don't agree with it, and I see negative value in a post like that. So I downvoted it. It's that simple.

Is it entitlement though?  Someone who wasn't do anything wrong had their account banned.  They're getting their account back, but they were unduly stressed and couldn't play for a while.  I would have been pissed if my account got banned.  I can't imagine you would have been happy if yours was banned either.

And downvoting isn't about whether you agree or disagree, it's about whether or not the post is valid or not (at least for Reddit anyways).  Regardless of your opinion, you shouldn't be downvoting for a legitmate question.  You should be downvoting for low effort content that doesn't add meaningful discussion.

And for that matter, why are you acting holier-than-thou?  On what grounds are you morally superior?  Being with the majority doesn't mean you're right.  For one thing, people act incredibly entitled when it comes to game balance and are frequently upvoted for it.  Someone asks a legitimate question, not even saying that Riot should compensate players, but only asking if they will, and they get downvoted harshly for it.

Honestly, I don't know why I expect more of any board not named Memes & Games
